results.content:
Midway through the course, I had give a 5 star rating. The reason for 5 star ratings were

Pros
Very systematic. 
Step by step. 
Instructor has taken time to make things simple but not simplistic

Upon completion, I have re-rated this course to 3.5 because of two extremely important gaps 

1. Themes & templates - How to develop and modify themes is not covered at all. In real life clients pay for look and feel first and then what is inside. Hence, this topic needs to be covered in depth. Maybe it can be the last segment so as not to disrupt the flow
2. Views: Views have been covered in very simple manner. Most real life projects need creation of views using SQL. A detailed chapter on writing and integration SQL queries will really take this course to another level.

This is the third review of the same course and I am re-rating it further down to 2.5 because

1. The course title claims "Expert". This is misleading because important topics mentioned above have not been given due justice and without an indepth knowledge of the above, one cannot become an expert. 

2. The course is aimed for non-programmers and this is said many times in the course. However, one cannot become an expert in any CMS or computer language unless one understands and learns how to code and integrate code in existing CMS systems - atleast to some degree.  

Bottomline: At best this course will give you a good overview of the Drupal and make you familiar with lots of functionalities - but don't expect to become an expert. Unless and until you are doing a very simplistic project, don't expect this course will make you ready for real life projects where clients make all kinds of demands.

results.content:
This course was just okay. 

The websites you are promised to build are not complete sites per se. They rather mostly revolve around key ideas that are being discussed in every section. For the most part you are repeatedly asked to apply basic site configuration settings. 

There are also hard coded subtitles which personally I did not appreciate, although some students may find useful, due to the heavy accent of the instructor.

Lastly the course ends rather abruptly with a brief discussion on a rather important Drupal feature - i.e. views - and not much further analysis. Definitely something you might want to consider.

response.content: Thank you for the candid review. But did you expect to learn production-ready sites in an introductory course on Drupal? :-) These projects are exactly and carefully selected to "revolve around key ideas", as you have said. Sincerely, Srikanth

results.content:
This course is a comprehensive overview of Drupal from an administrative perspective (vs a programming perspective).  I knew nothing about Drupal starting it, and upon completion I feel I have gained a decent understanding of how to use the product and why it considered a powerful player in the world of CMSs.
Pros: 
* Lessons were fairly detailed and hands-on
* Plenty of projects to help you put core concepts into action
* About 85% of the administration pages were covered
* Expanding native functionality using third-party themes and modules was covered in depth.
Cons:
* Lessons are slow at the beginning, then speed up quickly toward the end
* Some projects are repetitive

I think this tutorial is good if you are a very beginner.. However, the title is a bit misleading because this definitely does not make you a professional of Drupal 8.. at all. I have been disappointed of the level not high enough of the last courses..

response.content:
Thomas, thank you for writing a review. I will highly recommend that you take the time to read through the course description to find what the course is about. This Drupal course is purely for non-programmers and no coding is taught in the course. Its says so very clearly in the course description, in the intro video and in half a dozen other locations. The vast majority of Drupal users want to just implement Drupal for their business or for their clients or organization.  
Best regards,
Srikanth

results.content:
I took this course with the expectation of getting started on Drupal. It is said that learning Drupal has a steep learning curve. It would be reasonable for us to expect that the instructor is going to teach us alteast the basic building blocks of Drupal - like menus, dropdowns, blocks etc. However, I am at lecture 45 (60% of progress) and this course is a total eyewash. I am cursing those people who gave this course 4 star and 5 star rating leading me to buy this pathetic course with no valu.I do not know if those people were taken in by the instructor's sweet talk and promises in the introductory lessons. I am sure these people never bothered to finish the entire course. This is what I found out after spending my precious time on this Drupal course:

1) There are no in-depth explanations on the basic building blocks of Drupal. For example, Drop down menus are critical to any website. However, he does not spend more than 5 seconds (that's right, 5 seconds) in explaining how to create drop down menus. In project 5 (Recipe website) he says that he has created dropdown menus using Superfish plugin and that we also can do the same. However, Superfish plugin requires good amount of settings to be in place which he does not explain at all. This left me looking for explanations on youtube and google. It was immense effort and I thought if I had to do this than what is point of taking this course. If you do not even learn how to create dropdown menus than that course is useless.

2) All the projects that he mentions we are going to do (ecommerce website, recipe website, news website) are a hogwash. They are completed in 20 minutes because he leaves all the work to students and gives no in-depth explanations. He glides through complex topics like block layout settings, menus etc.

3) I posted by question in QNA section and there was no response. This instructor has a way of avoiding complex topics, explanations.

I am very disheartened and I can only strongly adivse others to stay away from this course. Apprearences are deceptive and while taking this course I thought this was a best seller and 4 star course. My guess is that the number of students who complete this course are in single digits. It is nearly impossible to complete any project except brochure website or blog setup which are beginner level.

I enrolled to this course because of two reasons that I saw in the introduction. I past the exact sentence here.
1. Build 8 fully functional DRUPAL PROJECTS from Scratch - from Beginner level to ADVANCED LEVEL.
2. Learn to use Drupal INDEPTH like an EXPERT ...
BUT, when i watched all lessons, he never ever wrote a single line of code, so how can he claim the course to be ADVANCED LEVEL? Nothing is from SCRATCH, he used all theme and module from free resources. I thought he is going to teach theme development from scratch. He postponed all the important points to later and the course ended without fulfilling those false promises. I am so disappointed with Udemy and I really don't recommend this course at all. You will find better than this course in Youtube for free. So Don't spend your money.

results.content:
YOU WILL NOT BE A DRUPAL EXPERT BY COMPLETING THIS COURSE. This course should be labled "beginner to kinda-slightly-better-beginner". The course does not discuss any fundemental programming concepts of drupal which are necessary to call yourself a drupal expert. If you want to learn the very basics of drupal using absolutley no programming, then sure this course is okay (there are definetly free courses online that discuss the concepts in this course), but DO NOT say you are a drupal expert if you do this course. You will know nothing. Here are some of the things that the course does not dive into: 
-drush
-hooks
-the different kinds of hooks and their use
-version control with drupal
I know this is a very salty review but the truth is there are better resouces out there to become a drupal expert (watch and learn on youtube is a good resource) and this is not one of them. Honestly, another good resouce is drupal's documentation. Go to drupal.org and read some of the intro documentation. It's not that bad. Sure there's a lot of different docs but trust me you will learn way more useful/applicable skills than from this course. I did this course to prep for an internship where I would be developing a website using drupal. When I started I could not believe how much I did not know. I found a bunch of better resources online.

TL;DR:
Do not buy this course to become a "Drupal expert"

UPDATE:
There are newer 1 star reviews for this course that the instructor has responded to which means my review is pretty accurate. So do not buy this course

results.content: Learned a bunch, just wish the instructor included ALL OF THE CONTENT necessary to make a site.  He typically includes just the basic resource material, then requires you to fetch or make up the balance on your own.   To best focus my time on "learning Drupal" (rather than finding content on the web or day dream making stuff up), I wish he included all of it in the downloadable content.  This will not only speed things up for the students, but it will also improve error checking (if my site does not look EXACTLY like his, I know I have to research something).  He was way to brief on the Superfish module set up & install... either tell us how to do it in more detail, or remove it.  I personally made the first ~3/4 websites as recommended by the course, but after wasting an hour+ trying to get Superfish working on the recipe website, I quit attempting to build my own and only watched the lessons.  I do like a style he used in the last 1-2 lectures.  When a website required you performing an action taught early on, he reminded you how to do it once and quickly (which left you to repeat 10+ times on your own).  That very quick "refresher" should be implemented in all the modules (not just the last).  I certainly learned a lot.  A couple of small tweaks could upgrade this course from a ~3/4 star to ~4/5 star.

results.content:
This course could have been excellent. Unfortunately it lacks major aspects necessary for on-line learning: full blown examples of what has been presented in a hurry. Experimentation is good but only if a student can fall back on a real example. Instead what is provided are mere outlines what needs to be done and, to add insult to injury, the details are only sufficiently detailed for the 1st steps. The remainder of the necessary steps are merely paragraph titles, exactly when detailed steps would be required the most. 
If you expect to get ANY help from the author, forget about it. Questions are either not answered or are even deleted for no obvious reason.
The lectures are good to get some overview of what Drupal is capable of, but that's about it.
I have used many  tutorials before; some of them are really excellent. This one is definitely not.

results.content:
I'm found this course great for my purposes. I have been maintaining a Drupal 6 site for the last 9 years with the aid of an experienced developer who is no longer available. So those 9 years of becoming a bit familiar with Drupal concepts has made the journey in this course very smooth and easy so far. I have now finished this course and found it extremely informative and useful.

I have a new Drupal 8 test site which was created by a commercial company and recreates my Drupal 6 site in Drupal 8.

However, I am still waiting for some responses to my questions. 

In particular I would appreciate some guidance on where to go next to continue from where this course ends.

My new test Drupal site which was created by a commercial company was left by them in a poor state and I am struggling to understand how the CSS and other coding was incorporated. So, at this stage it feels like I have a long way to go in order to gain control of my test site.

Thank You
Gary

results.content:
I purchased this course to be able to build the various projects alongside the instructor. That's impossible to do without stopping and restarting the videos a thousand times because the instructor decided to race through those areas of instruction for some reason in favor of endlessly going over the various Drupal functions. While I understand some repetition is necessary, I found myself mentally checking out during a handful of videos because of how often things were repeated. 

There are videos that need updates to incorporate changes to Drupal 8. You can find information about the changes if you dig through the downloadable resources, but it's on you to do it. There's no mention in any of the videos anywhere that the information is there or how to find it. I literally stumbled across some of the information I needed while poking around in a download file, looking for something else entirely.

All in all, I'm thankful I took another Drupal 8 course before this one. I would have been frustrated to the point of giving up on doing any of the projects otherwise.

Shortly: I was looking for something different. The description of the course is very deceptive. Overall, I am very disappointed. I give 2 star rank only because I had no experience with Drupal at all and some information where useful.

What I did not like: 
- showing me admin_toolbar at the end of course. We could save so much time
- External modules should be introduced at the beginning. I had to google how to make the blue button "Install new modules" visible.
- too much time spent on doing the same action over and over. How many times can you show how to change the basic web configuration? If we make assumption that I can not  remember how to change slogan and site name we should not even bother doing anything else. 
-nothing about themes... I did not expect you to cover CSS but I WOULD LOVE TO KNOW how to simply change any element of the page.
- there is no single project I can be proud of.

Drupal learning will never be "completed" - as it is a framework designed to be like exactly that!! If this course provides you a platform through which you can jump into real world applications with Drupal - and you are able to learn new things by yourself - the purpose of this course is solved. 

Best wishes on all your Drupal endeavors.

results.content: The reason I am giving 3 stars is because I found alot of holes in the delivery. It would be alot better if the instructor stopped skipping important steps. For example taxonomy menus. At least showing students one example instead of leaving them in the deep end would improve the learning experience. Leaving them in the deep end can be very discouraging to a first time student. It may take some time for a student to figure out what to select eg. taxonomy terms, limited or unlimited. If you feel it is repetitive at least show one example then leave the students to figure out the rest. This would be good guidance. You showed a menu called superfish. It wouldn't hurt to show how it can be installed. Students can get confused when they don't find a folder called libraries in their local folder. At least show how you installed yours. The aim of a good course is to deliver an outstanding experience to the student. You're showing the finished product but now showing how you arrived there. Good course but you are skipping alot of critical parts.  This slows down the study process. Also if you find it hard to repeat things at least give us a reference point e.g. "If you need to go over how to do taxonomies, refer to chapter 2.4" or something along those lines. Instead of having students going back trying to figure out where it is everytime you start a new drupal site. This course could be better if some thought was put into the user experience. I hope you can address these issues.

response.content:
Hi Felix Rumah, 

Thank you for the very detailed review - it shows the course kept you HIGHLY ENGAGED - and it is a very positive sign for me. 

YESTERDAY, you rated this course 3 stars because you couldn't get the Zircon theme (a 3rd party plugin) to work - and TODAY you are rating it low because you couldn't get a 3rd party menu (Superfish) to work! So, I will take your review with a pinch of salt. 

My key objective is to teach learners to be hands-on, independent and self-sufficient. This is a FUNDAMENTAL aspect of working with open-source projects. That is the reason I have 8 hands-on projects - progressively complex. All my learners appreciate the fast pace - and that I do not repeat teachings just to expand the course. 

This course encourages all learners to APPLY learnings hands-on, think through what is being taught, to question, to experiment, to explore, to try things independently! This is what is required to build great projects in the real world. If you expect to be spoonfed through the course - perhaps open source is not for you. 

You have asked several questions through the course - and I have answered all of them without exception. You could have asked more questions without writing such a review - and I would have explained to you. 

Hundreds of esteemed learners have successfully implemented the assignments and exercises very successfully - and they have pasted screenshots and thanked me for the learning experience - whilst asking for even more challenges. So - I will take that as a positive affirmation of the course design. 

I wish the very best to you - and request that you apply yourself more to the projects. Only honest hard work and application will help ultimately. 

Sincerely,
Srikanth

results.content: This is a good overall course on the use of Drupal 8.  The scope was well focused and I found the projects a good help in cementing the content shown.  But I do find the material a little dated but overall is still relevant.  However, the course hasn't been kept up as well as I would like as there are apparent gaps in versions.  The instructor starts by using Drupal 8.3.2 and finishes with version 8.4.4.  Further, the material references 10 projects yet only delivers on 8.  That overall wouldn't be a problem for a course in progress but currently (as of this review) Drupal is on version 8.8.5.  This seems to be a rather large gap since any additional content has been released.  Hopefully, more content will be provided in the near future.
